Managing a condo with Excel spreadsheets? ğŸ˜¤

I was too. Tracking 7 units, 140+ ledger entries, quarterly fees, delinquencies...

So I built an OS that does it all from Notion + AI.

11 databases. 17 commands. One setup.

https://casedamare.github.io/condo-os

After years of managing a 7-unit condo with spreadsheets, I built something better.

Condo Manager OS turns Notion into a full property management system:

âœ… 11 interconnected databases (auto-created)
âœ… 17 CLI commands for daily operations
âœ… Owner self-service portal (Telegram bot)

Built by a property manager, for property managers.

Free & open source: https://github.com/casedamare/condo-os

TITLE: I built an open-source condo management OS with Notion + AI â€” 11 databases, 17 commands, owner portal

After years of Excel hell managing a small condo (7 units), I built Condo Manager OS.

It turns Notion into a complete property management system with one setup command. 11 databases auto-created with relations, formulas, and rollups.

Features:
- Fee calls, payment tracking, statements
- Delinquency tracking with aging
- Owner portal (Telegram bot â€” owners check their own balance)
- Auto late-fee calculation
- Voting system with weighted quorum
- 5 live dashboards
- Excel import for migration
- Trilingual (ES/EN/FR)

Free on GitHub: https://github.com/casedamare/condo-os

Been using it in production for my own building. Would love feedback from other condo/HOA managers.

Your HOA treasurer is using a $4,800/year SaaS to manage 10 units? ğŸ¤¯

Condo Manager OS: $149 one-time. Or free (open source).

â€¢ 11 Notion databases
â€¢ Owner portal bot
â€¢ Auto payment reminders
â€¢ Weighted voting system

Built by a real condo manager.

https://casedamare.github.io/condo-os

The average HOA management software costs $744-4,800/year.

For a 7-unit condo, that's insane.

I built Condo Manager OS â€” a Notion-based system that does 90% of what Buildium does, for $149 one-time (or free on GitHub).

The secret? Notion as the database + AI for automation.

No monthly fees. No vendor lock-in. Your data stays yours.

https://github.com/casedamare/condo-os

Every condo board meeting:

"Who owes what?"
"Did we pay the plumber?"
"What's our cash position?"

*frantically opens 4 spreadsheets*

Or... just type: condo-cli dashboard

https://casedamare.github.io/condo-os

One command:
condo-cli vote "Roof Repair" --meeting="AGM 2026"

"Send me my account statement"

â†’ Creates all relations

Payment plans for delinquent owners:

$ condo-cli payment-plan A-1 187000 --installments=12

â†’ Track compliance automatically

Because legal action should be the last resort.

https://casedamare.github.io/condo-os

7 automation workflows running 24/7:

âœ… Payment received â†’ notify admin + owner

Built Condo Manager OS in a week.

11 Notion databases
17 CLI commands
Owner portal bot
7 automation workflows
5 live dashboards
2,922 lines of CLI code

Powered by OpenClaw AI + Notion API.

The future of property management is AI-native.

https://github.com/casedamare/condo-os

Day 1: "I need a better way to track condo finances"

Building with AI doesn't just save time.
It makes you build things you'd never attempt.

setup.js: 1,020 lines
â†’ Creates 11 Notion databases
â†’ Wires 19 dual relations
â†’ Generates 16 formulas (including weighted vote calculations)
â†’ Sets rollups, colors, icons
â†’ One command. Zero manual setup.

This is what AI-native tooling looks like.

https://github.com/casedamare/condo-os

TIL: Notion formulas can calculate weighted voting quorum.

Each unit has an ownership % hardcoded in the formula.
Votes are select fields (For/Against/Abstain/Absent).
Formulas auto-calculate totals + quorum + pass/fail.

No code needed at runtime. Pure Notion.

https://github.com/casedamare/condo-os
